website_summaries.verdict: If you don't need extremely tough keys for major jobs and like the foldable design, this duo is a good choice. They're perfect for minor projects around the house.
pros: You get both inch and metric sets w/17 total keys
A variety of sizes in convenient storage cases that double as tool handles
cons: The keys don't have the strong build of costlier models, and some don't fit tightly in the case
The unit is awkward to use in small, tight spaces

customer_reviews.title: If you assemble a lot of furniture then buy these now...
customer_reviews.text: I have been using hex keys for years, mostly ones that come w whatever Ikea or Staples office furniture that I need to put together. That being said, I will never go back to using the in box hex key! These hex key sets allow you to grip the wrench much more and in turn allow you to tighten the screws much better and faster. For instance, I was able to put together a heavy duty office chair a bit faster using this hex key set than if I was using the in box wrench. I couldn't be happier with this purchase and the quality of Stanley products makes me believe this set will last me a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Aronne

customer_reviews.title: Great all around for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price. The set is bigger in size than I expected and easy to grip. The handles/holders for each set are made out of a hard plastic, with softer rubber type grips around the edges. The holder also has each size marked and is easy to read. Hopefully the plastic assembly and spacing between the keys holds up, and doesn't break too quickly heavier jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can't get much torque, does NOT make up for actual loose wrenches in amount of torque.
customer_reviews.text: it's nice to have both metric and standard sizes all in one place where I won't lose the individual wrenches. I keep these in my camera bag since so many photography products are made with hex screws and they all differ from size to standard or metric.. The only issue I have is you can't get much torque due to the construction of the product...I'm afraid i'll snap the wrench right off the product.
customer_reviews.author: William J. Dabovich

customer_reviews.title: Economical Folding Hex Drivers for Light Duty Use
customer_reviews.text: Economical folding metric and SAE hex set. These work okay for light duty use. The handle feels weak, and the wrench action does not feel right (stiff at first, then falls open). The steel seems cheap, and is well-oiled to minimize rusting, so I'm not sure how long they'll last. If you need an inexpensive set of folding hex wrenches that are not intended for heavy duty use, these will do fine. Otherwise, I'd look for a higher quality set.
customer_reviews.author: Hawaii

customer_reviews.title: This not only is comfortable in your hands
customer_reviews.text: What a steal, at least in my opinion. I cannot beginning to tell you have many hex sets I have had and lost over the years. The standard, on a key ring type, was what I could find normally. This not only is comfortable in your hands, the craftsmanship is solid. I have one in my tool bag, I gave one to a mechanic friend of mine (who was using the ring style or the driver set). I will order more and give to a few family members and perhaps have a spare for myself. The price is just too good
customer_reviews.author: M Hall

customer_reviews.title: Just as expected
customer_reviews.text: Useful to have, and cheaper than some other comparable packages. They seem well built, but there isn't really much to go wrong with a set of hex keys. You can tighten the rotating mechanism; the SAE set has a metric adjustment screw, and the metric set has an SAE adjustment screw, which was good thinking! If you're looking to build your own basic set of tools (as I was) there are some homeowner's kits here that appear to be more cost effective than building your own set, and also come with a tool box/organizer. I wish I had known about those before I started buying various single tools.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: I love this set!
customer_reviews.text: I am really pleased with this Allen wrench set. I used it right away to adjust my chainsaw. The wrenches and handle are well made and sturdy, and the handle is comfortable to hold. I'll never have to worry about losing a particular size since they are all connected to the handle. Stanley tools are always great and they hit another home run with this one. (I should note that some of the reviews imply that the package contains two identical sets. Instead, it has one SAE and one metric set on separate handles. That's actually better for my purposes.)
customer_reviews.author: Joy A. Rimpau

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected but still good
customer_reviews.text: First off. I did not receive the items shown in the picture, it’s a different style and they’re not labeled with M and S. Obviously it’s no challenge to read the numbers and see if they are whole numbers or fractions and know which is which but at a glance they’re identical. Other than that it seems like a strong durable product. I would recommend loosening up the bolts on each of them though as they were very tight when they arrived and the keys started to bend as I was trying to pull them out. The 4mm works for the S and the 5/32 works for the M.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Both SAE and Metric!
customer_reviews.text: If you have a toolbox and you don't have these — get ’em. These are terrifically handy, and Stanley is still a superior brand. You can lose a whole set, but you can't lose just the one key you need right now.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Matson

customer_reviews.title: Finger jammers
customer_reviews.text: The keys do not lock or stay in place when in use. I could not tighten anything on my workout machine without jamming my fingers. Terrible experience.
customer_reviews.author: Meggy

customer_reviews.title: Always have the right hex wrench...
customer_reviews.text: Hex wrenches (or allen wrenches) are one of those tools that you will get 10 of them from your tool box but each and everyone of them will be the wrong one when you need on for a project. These folding sets of wrenches make sure that you have pretty much every size of hex wrench that would will ever need. The quality of the wrenches is just OK, but the for the price they are a great way to always have the right tool for the job.
customer_reviews.author: J Johnson

customer_reviews.title: You never know when you’ll need it, but you will.
customer_reviews.text: Do yourself a favor and get yourself this set of hex keys. You may not think you need them, but sometime you will. And when you do, you never know whether you’ll need a metric or sae hex key. Exactly what you’d expect from Stanley - durable, well-built tools. I’ve had a various Allen wrenches and hex keys before. This is by far the best.
customer_reviews.author: Holly B.

customer_reviews.title: Great every-tool, just be careful with the smaller keys.
customer_reviews.text: I've used these for everything from assembling furniture to adjusting my monitor mounts to adding/removing accessories from the picatinny rails on my firearms. The construction is pretty solid but since they are all fixed to handle, the smaller keys run the risk of snapping if you apply to too much pressure to the fulcrum.
customer_reviews.author: Clark Kent

customer_reviews.title: poorly made
customer_reviews.text: I used these only a couple of times. One of the two fell apart. The fastener fell off of the shaft each key is attached to. Since I couldn't find the fastener so it's useless.
customer_reviews.author: Florida Native

customer_reviews.title: Fits All You Allen Needs
customer_reviews.text: They can fold up to be compact and easily stored. They have all of the allen wrench sizes to fit your need. The wrench that they fold into also helps for leverage when you need to turn on those tight nuts and bolts.
customer_reviews.author: Lance A.

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended
customer_reviews.text: One small complaint. Units in advertised picture have M for metric and S for SAE printed on the handles. Mine does not so I have to check the keys themselves to make sure I have the proper set.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pay attention to sizes
customer_reviews.text: I failed to pay close attention to key sizes on the sae. I intended to use it as a backup to an RCBS for my range bag but the Stanley lacks two smaller keys that are needed for some optics. The quality though is still excellent so I can't downgrade it because of my mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Little Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great price, convenient and tough as nails
customer_reviews.text: This was a great purchase. Not only was the price fantastic, but these are all in a "Loss-proof" housing. You don't have to worry about losing one, since they are all held together in one convenient place. Very good addition to any toolbox or EDC kit.
customer_reviews.author: Clint F.

customer_reviews.title: Decent enough
customer_reviews.text: Came in handy when trying to assemble some shelving units at home. Seems to be a little wobbly when applying the last tightening twist to the screws??? Will come in handy as more time passes and I know I have them.
customer_reviews.author: K. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality!
customer_reviews.text: I really like these allen wrenches. I use them for my compound bow. They slide in and out of position easily and because they are supported on both sides by plastic divider, they stay in position.
customer_reviews.author: Madison

customer_reviews.title: Does what you would expect. No disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: Nice set with common sizes. Does the job. The best is to have individual wrenches that can maneuver better and are often longer, but the purpose here is to have them all in one place and organized.
customer_reviews.author: Kraftykiller

customer_reviews.title: Decent...
customer_reviews.text: Decent allen wrenches. One small nitpick: The size of each wrench is printed on the tool, for easy selection. However, on the metric unit, the sizes are printed too far inboard, such that they are covered by the wrench when the tool is folded shut, so you need to fold out the wrenches to be able to read their sizes. This doesn't seem to have been a technical need to print them in that location, there is plenty of space that would not have been covered, but they just didn't think about it. The SAE tool was labeled correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply Made
customer_reviews.text: The SAE set broke off in my hand when I was tightening a hex bolt, ruining the entire set. Cheaply made and does not provide enough torque to effectively tighten your bolts.
customer_reviews.author: JW Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Suitable for work where there is no strong effort
customer_reviews.text: Made quite conveniently, but the quality of the metal leaves much to be desired. A little stronger force and the edges of the tool break. I can not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Ildar

customer_reviews.title: Not as sturdy/durable as I had hoped
customer_reviews.text: If you need to get things very tight, this is not the tool for you. Once you put pressure on it, it has some 'give' to it. I haven't broken it, but I feel like I will if I push it too hard.
customer_reviews.author: Crazed in Black

customer_reviews.title: Great set! Helps with leverage.
customer_reviews.text: I was afraid these hex keys would be too bulky because of the set all attached together but so far I have not had any issues. In fact, I really like how you can pry one hex key out and the rest of the tool becomes a "handle". It really provides great leverage and torque to help you turn the key, much better than a bare key that could dig into your palms. find this set no more bulkier than a screw driver handle. You can even pry an individual key straight out and use the set in screw driver style if you turn slowly.
customer_reviews.author: Ketty

customer_reviews.title: Good news, Bad News
customer_reviews.text: - Now that Stanley and DeWalt and a number of others are all owned by the same company Stanley has improved - can't say the same for DeWalt. Not as well made as the Bondhus ones that were lifted out of my tool box but a good replacement for the price. If you are interested in who owns what in tools, the link is below (Amazon will probably pull it as they always do) {[...]}
customer_reviews.author: Mister C

customer_reviews.title: Round off. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Usually have no issues with Stanley products. But these hex heads round out under the slightest stress. Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Liquid Lab Fx

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: So much nicer having all these in one place instead of all unorganized and loose. Last set I hope I ever need!
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Caswell

customer_reviews.title: Good value for money
customer_reviews.text: Great product, had to find something to do with the second one which was a gift for a friend, he liked it. Good value for money.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Necessary for every home shop
customer_reviews.text: Most popular sizes for standard and metric hex bolts. Nothing fancy it just does what it is supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: L. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Very handy & compact to keep in my desk drawer...
customer_reviews.text: These are very handy for me to have readily accessible access to for small projects around the house...
customer_reviews.author: John Kully

customer_reviews.title: Great set, read my set up and you will be stoked too!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome set of Allen’s! Just make sure you loosen up the side bolt to remove the card stock they are attached to. Also tighten em up so they are firm for your grip. Simple steps that seem obvious but people would rather complain than figure it out themselves
customer_reviews.author: Catarino C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Hex Keys
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed to fix a screw in a door handle. And now I can use it for some furniture that needs to be tightened.
customer_reviews.author: KaiKev

customer_reviews.title: Great to keep the set together.
customer_reviews.text: Very handy to keep the set together but doesn’t work I. Certain situations that are tight.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Accidental buy, friend enjoying them.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these accidentally after realizing I already have an SAE and metric set. Gave them t a friend and he is happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Decent if you're not doing any real work
customer_reviews.text: The plastic is flimsy and will crack if used on a nut that is firmly attached. Great for working on my guitars, not so great for working on my bikes
customer_reviews.author: Lions and Associates, LLC

customer_reviews.title: Handy and labeled sizes
customer_reviews.text: These are handy to have and at a great price. Each of them are labeled on the inside of the handle so that you don't have to spend time finding the size if you already know it. As always Stanley is a good purchase with their lifetime warranty. But be careful with them, you can possibly strip them when tightening bolts, they could be made from harder metal. But if you are careful they should last.
customer_reviews.author: astrochemist

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but great tool
customer_reviews.text: Good quality multiple fits of the Alan key, great for on the go bike adjustments but quite a heavy little tool.
customer_reviews.author: Dayna G.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice and just what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: Great tools, period. They come in the sizes stated which of course is expected. I really knew these were good tools when I had to break out an 8mm hex head and I had to put some serious torque on it and they held up. In addition, the tool fits so well in my hands-it is so much more comfortable to use than a screwdriver etc and gives you much more torque when needed by folding it down to a right angle. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Inability to lock in place is a flaw
customer_reviews.text: The product is acceptable but overall I was slightly disappointed. Yes it does give you lots of options in terms of your hex/alan wrench needs but the biggest issue I have is that the keys do not 'lock' when you want to use them. This is a pretty big oversight in my opinion because it makes them much more difficult to use - they should lock in 2 positions (perpendicular and straight) - that would make it much more useful. Without locking you have to rely on holding it in place yourself and that's not always easy. As a result I have found myself just using my old keys more often than this set
customer_reviews.author: That Helpful Dad

customer_reviews.title: Set screws fall out
customer_reviews.text: Both wrenches lost their set screws that hold the wrenches in the case. Luckily I didn't lose the screw and was able to put them back together again. I just thought that the quality level was lacking.
customer_reviews.author: Mark J Britton

customer_reviews.title: Every toolbox needs this set.
customer_reviews.text: Great set to have on-hand. Throw away all those loose Allen wrenches and keep this set handy.
customer_reviews.author: aavantinsc

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: These are really good tools. Good selection with the different sizes on each one. I needed a simple, sturdy set. Has a good grip when using.
customer_reviews.author: 4fam

customer_reviews.title: Stanley STHT71839 Folding Metric and Sae Hex Keys, 2-Pack
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect. Just what I was looking for. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff S.

customer_reviews.title: ... I haven't had to use it much it's been great. I like both kinds cause my power chair ...
customer_reviews.text: Although I haven't had to use it much it's been great. I like both kinds cause my power chair has both metric and "normal" sizes.
customer_reviews.author: DebaSaurus

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but the handle can get in the way ...
customer_reviews.text: Not bad, but the handle can get in the way of getting into tight spaces. A 'free' wrench hex key set is way more versatile. The convenience of having them housed in a handle has a price - you'll pay it when you get into a tight, small spot and need those tiniest keys.
customer_reviews.author: M. Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient
customer_reviews.text: Nice having everything right there. Easy to use and convenient. Stanley makes good tools.
customer_reviews.author: Micah

customer_reviews.title: Great for household jobs.
customer_reviews.text: These are a couple of nice hex key sets for household use. The only reason I gave them 4 stars is because I am an electrician and was trying to go cheap, but I could tell by handling them that they wouldn't last long on what I do so I went ahead and payed the extra for the Kleins. They are an asset to my shop collection though.
customer_reviews.author: John F Graf

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Hex Set.
customer_reviews.text: Made of good lasting material. This tool is great quality and will last for years to come! Comes with most common hex sizes that I have needed around the house and office.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Wilborn

customer_reviews.title: Good find
customer_reviews.text: Got them for work and they do the job pretty well
customer_reviews.author: Dusti Cribbs

customer_reviews.title: Nice and compact,  great for random furniture assembly
customer_reviews.text: Nice and compact, great for random furniture assembly. Can never find those dang hex wrenches that come with furniture, these are much easier to keep track of.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have get both American and metric system
customer_reviews.text: ​I had different sets from time to time and kept losing them. This two sets should take care of them from now on. I like the fact that it includes both American and Metric set.
customer_reviews.author: JKShopper

customer_reviews.title: Good value for a great range of Hex Keys
customer_reviews.text: They don't feel like the most rugged tool around, as the grip is plastic and has some flexing, but for the value they are a good addition to throw in the tool kit. This design is much better than the kits that have the keys loose because we all know those end up getting lost, so I went with this to solve that issue.
customer_reviews.author: nickw

customer_reviews.title: Good concept...
customer_reviews.text: Shoudl have returns, does not have the correct size needed.
customer_reviews.author: R. White

customer_reviews.title: works as it should - now to keep my kids from 'borrowing it!
customer_reviews.text: when you need one you really need one - how fast can you say loose doorknob?
customer_reviews.author: askworldtraveler

customer_reviews.title: It comes all size in one. Easy to find when u kept in the tools box.
customer_reviews.text: It easy to grip at any angle while doing the job.
customer_reviews.author: MOHAMMAD KODRASONO

customer_reviews.title: FIT FOR A COMPLETE REIGN
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. Easy to handle. We use the Allen’s for our bikes and a lot of other things. Great
customer_reviews.author: ZipMan

customer_reviews.title: Great set
customer_reviews.text: I constantly lose my allen wrenches. This set obviously solves that issue and the grip is very nice. No more searching for the correct wrench.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher A. Naramor

customer_reviews.title: Who Knew?
customer_reviews.text: I honestly didn’t realize there were so many different sizes in an Allen wrench. I’m not going to need another Allen wrench for the rest of my life.
customer_reviews.author: Riss Segers

customer_reviews.title: Great for small jobs.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect set! I like this format for quick little jobs. Easy to find the right size I need. The handle just makes it a little difficult to turn, but for small jobs it's not an issue. If you have to turn stiff or tight screws, this won't work as well because there is little leverage.
customer_reviews.author: daymeeyan

customer_reviews.title: All common sizes.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect as expected. Time tested tool design. Gives good leverage.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Whisner

customer_reviews.title: Nice set, but the quality is a bit questionable.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is a nice set, but the quality of the set is not top notch. I have some pictures that show the sub par fit and finish at ediblefrog.com/topics/frogblogger/stanley_stht71839_folding_metric_and_sae_hex_keys-_2-pack_review. The functionality of the set does not seem to be affected by the fit an finish so for all practical purposes this set will do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Mungo Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Great tools for the money
customer_reviews.text: I was replacing a knock off set that were all twisted. These seem to hold up a lot better.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, a little bulky
customer_reviews.text: I bought this explicitly because it's just two easily found pieces. I didn't want to lose individual hex keys. It is exactly what is advertised. My major grip is that it is bulky. It's hard to use in small spaces. Using it for occasional jobs and tightening lose bolts it does adequately. If assembling IKEA furniture or working in small spaces you will still want to use individual allen wrenches. At least I can pitch the IKEA wrenches after purchasing this.
customer_reviews.author: David Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and practical.
customer_reviews.text: Great. Exactly what I needed. If you want the piece to stay in place while in use simply tighten the screw that holds all of them in place.
customer_reviews.author: Queens Bookworm

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set for my son-in-law, but now I want a set of my own.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy L

customer_reviews.title: Compact and Works Well
customer_reviews.text: These were well priced and I needed them for my bag I take in my car with other smaller tools to have with me when I take my camper places. They work well. Just used one recently when I was tightening a "screw" to hold in place while I used another tool (star type) to tighten that screw in place in a relax recliner.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte Key

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: I wish it was more like a regular Allen wrench so you could get in tight spaces.
customer_reviews.author: Jhudd

customer_reviews.title: Good allen wrencches
customer_reviews.text: I have bought cheap ones and within a couple of days, they come appart. These are well made and strong.
customer_reviews.author: Keith T. Kotris

customer_reviews.title: I need a hex key to take out my hex keys
customer_reviews.text: They're really fat when on the holder. I have to take out the keys when I use them for tight places like my bike. I need a hex key to take out my hex keys. Not very convenient when I'm biking trails.
customer_reviews.author: Isabel

customer_reviews.title: Reliable Products.
customer_reviews.text: Stanley products have been on the market for a long time. Their products are reliable and long lasting. It's products like these Hex tools and other Stanley tools I don't have a problem adding to my tool box. I know when needed they'll come through to complete the task at hand.
customer_reviews.author: Hugh C.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great little tool kit, extra protection in my carry bag in case I run into different screw heads.
customer_reviews.author: Speedy

customer_reviews.title: great buy
customer_reviews.text: had the for over a year still work great. I mainly use them for service work but when I have bear down on something they still hold up. use them everyday for changing bit blades and the like
customer_reviews.author: fivemightylions

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I expected. The Hex Keys seem to be made of good durable material. All of the usual sizes are there for both metric and standard. The whole unit seems to be durable and built to last. I have used these on different projects and not had any issues at all. If I ever lose these, I will definitely buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Axcro

customer_reviews.title: They are all there !!!
customer_reviews.text: I don't need these keys that often but they are nice to have. I have about 12 in my toolbox (loose) and of course non of them fit. Now I will always have them in one place. People would take one out of my tool box but they never make it bake in. They were scattered throughout the house, Good sturdy quality also, very solid
customer_reviews.author: AIgarvy

customer_reviews.title: handy product
customer_reviews.text: Compact and easy to use No more messy boxes to search thru bright color easy to find in small toolbox
customer_reviews.author: James Crampton

customer_reviews.title: My go-to Alan set
customer_reviews.text: My go to set when I’m at work. Will last you a year or two before any signs of wear and tear happen
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: HD performance!
customer_reviews.text: Great tool, must have! I carry one on my mt bike, drift boat, sailboat on both pickups!
customer_reviews.author: Sage

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed best option for a metric and standard set of hex wrenches at a really reasonable price. I’ve been using them to make adjustments on my hunting bow along with other odd jobs.
customer_reviews.author: average_fellow

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These have come in very handy. They look durable. So far they are working as should.
customer_reviews.author: Antraxxx

customer_reviews.title: A necessity for all toolboxes.
customer_reviews.text: Really helps when putting furniture together. Helps to save time.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: I keep these on my bikes. Best travel Hexs for light tool boxes.
customer_reviews.text: Best back up to T handles and if you need a travel tool box these are perfect!
customer_reviews.author: LKNANML

customer_reviews.title: but these are really cool! The case is strong and sturdy so you ...
customer_reviews.text: I never thought I'd be impressed by a pocket allen wrench set, but these are really cool! The case is strong and sturdy so you can get a lot of torque, and if you run into something while turning, you just flip to the other side and keep turning. Clever!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: OK But not two identical wrenches
customer_reviews.text: Seem of good quality. My mistake was not realizing that these are not two identical wrenches - one is metric and one is not. I think they should have been more clearly described as such.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Erlanger

customer_reviews.title: Now People will stop Losing my Hex Keys.
customer_reviews.text: I like these a bit better than the loose hex key sets. Perhaps if I were the only one that ever used my tools, it wouldn't matter. But I'm not, so it does, and it's harder to lose the set that on wrench. Seems well made, I don't expect any problems with them.
customer_reviews.author: Voracious Reader

customer_reviews.title: Way too loose
customer_reviews.text: I rarely give anything less than 4-5 stars. These hex keys work but they are really loose. Makes it hard to keep them in place and turn. Doubt you could get much torque with these. I only use these to punch holes in drywall to install drywall anchors and such.
customer_reviews.author: edward m grier

customer_reviews.title: Excellent set
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband when he started a new position at work and he needed a good set of tools. He LOVES these and frequently has co-workers borrowing since they usually need either metric or sae as they don't commonly carry both. Very happy with this set and the ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: kraaigirl

customer_reviews.title: Makes organizing hex keys easy
customer_reviews.text: I always misplace my hex wrenches and get frustrated when i can't find the right size. This makes it so much easier for someone like me that has trouble keeping my tools organized.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Portillo

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Better than having a bunch of loose allen wrenches. They never get separated.
customer_reviews.author: Armand St Marseille

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: Works fine for me. Won't get into some spots because of length.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Young

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Will wear down pretty fast, but not bad for cheap tools
customer_reviews.author: Thunar

customer_reviews.title: Great value...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the SAE allen wrenches to make adjustments to my PSE and Diamond bows. I could have gone out and bought a Pine Ridge XL, but at 14.99, this was more of a value since you get the metric sizing as well. Good quality.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: ... pair of metric and SAE hex wrenches is an excellent quality set of tools for an excellent price
customer_reviews.text: This pair of metric and SAE hex wrenches is an excellent quality set of tools for an excellent price. They fold out easily and appear to be very sturdy - and it should be easy to keep from losing individual wrenches. Losing the entire set... that's always possible.
customer_reviews.author: Pat T.

customer_reviews.title: It’s an alright product, for how affordable it is
customer_reviews.text: It has mostly all the sizes I use on my car, and hasn’t stripped so far. However, it feels a bit flimsy when turning and the black powdercoat pretty much immediately rubbed off
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fits in your pocket if you have a project around the house.
customer_reviews.author: gunshells

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend buying
customer_reviews.text: Nice and small compact to carry with my tool kit
customer_reviews.author: Stormtracker

customer_reviews.title: Good, affordable hex key solution
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. It's a convenient set that covers pretty much all common situations. I'm happy with it, though the quality isn't exactly premium.
customer_reviews.author: WeeN

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a solid product but not what I was looking ...
customer_reviews.text: Not a 2-pack. One set is metric the other SAE. I purchased under the impression it was two of each set total. Seems like a solid product but not what I was looking for, will still be useful in a larger tool kit I keep in another bag.
customer_reviews.author: A. Kiszelewski

customer_reviews.title: I just figured it was a good purchase since it comes in a nice handy thing ...
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had to use these yet, I just figured it was a good purchase since it comes in a nice handy thing and is compact for the different sizes!
customer_reviews.author: Alec

product_meta.title: Stanley STHT71839 Folding Metric and Sae Hex Keys, 2-Pack
product_meta.description: STANLEY STHT71839 2pk FOLDING METRIC HEX KEYS: This unit features durable composite construction. The rubber side inserts allow for a secure grip and the chamfered edge helps guide the wrench for a smooth, easy entry of the hex key. It has size markings printed on the hex key body for easy identification. This is a compact, self-storing tool. This tool meets ANSI specifications.
feature_bullets: Rubber side inserts for secure grip
